Name: Victoria Harbour on Board
Description:
Victoria Harbour On Board is one of the Hong Kong On Board series. The chess pieces are designed with local characteristics, and players can use them to travel through different districts in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour On Board can bring players closer together and enhance their understanding of the different districts in Hong Kong. It is a very special souvenir with Hong Kong characteristics. (from game box)

Players start their custom, Hong Kong-themed pieces at square on on the heavy paper playmat. They then roll a die to progress to square 81 encountering various Hong Kong landmarks on the way. Similar to Snakes and Ladders, these landmarks can move you ahead or send you back on your path. For example, landing on square 23 lets you take the tram to square 29. While essentially a reskinning of Snakes and Ladders, the Hong Kong theme and nice metal tokens makes this a fun souvenir that can spark memories of a visit through playing the game.

—user summary

Name: Dark Tales: Snow White and Little Red Riding Hood
Description:
The card game Dark Tales is inspired by classic fairy tales, retold in a dark style. Correspondingly, the land of Dark Tales is populated by disturbing creatures and sinister characters, and the interaction between cards and magic items is the key to success: A character, event, or sword used at the right time can determine the fate of the game! Thanks to the many setting cards, the items you collect change their power from game to game.

This game combines Snow White and Little Red Riding Hood versions of Dark Tales in one box.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Little Red Riding Hood
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Heiki Strike Alternative
Description:
In Heiki Strike Alternative (å…µå§«ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚¯ ã‚ªãƒ«ã‚¿ãƒŠãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–), the two players each build their own deck from the cards in the box, then deploy their princesses and anthropomorphized weapons to sea and air spaces in a fight to occupy the battlefields. To do this, a player must meet the "occupation conditions" for a battlefield, after which they take the battlefield card. Whoever claims three battlefield cards first wins.

Players will grow stronger over the course of the game through the playing of cards. If a player empties their deck, they shuffle the discarded cards in their reserve to create a new deck, rebuild their base, and now get more resources each turn — but if they run through their deck a third time, they lose.

Name: BattleClaw
Description:
Want to be a mighty BattleClaw warrior? Play the exciting Battle Mode and Advanced Battle Mode game at home — or anywhere you want!

You and one other player can face off for an epic match of BattleClaw in both Battle Mode and Advanced Battle Mode! Take turns using your claw to catch Jinlins and create powerful beasts to attack your opponent. The first player to defeat all 3 of the opponent’s beasts wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rolling CUBES ABC
Description:
Rolling CUBES ABC is a game that allow you to have fun coming up with long words with the letters you rolled.

The box contains 13 wooden dice of different colours based on the letters and symbols that appear on them. The symbol "=" allow you to copy a letter already present in your word, while "≠" can be used instead of a letter that is not present.

You can play 3 different games (as standalone or as a tournament) and a variant based on YAHTZEE (playable solo). The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make the longest word possible, also trying to score bonuses (using the same letter multiple times for example).

Name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Snow & Ice Battlepack
Description:
Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Snow & Ice Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards (2 of which are new random 'Snow & Ice-themed kaiju) , 3 random Zone cards (1 of which is a new random Snow & Ice Zone) , 2 Bonus Cards and rules!

This is a standalone pack and can also be integrated with any other Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Battlecards.

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.

-description from designer

Name: Druglord: Lord of Drugs
Description:
Two to six up-and-coming bosses of the global narco-trade vie to distrubute illicit substances by land, sea, or air while evading Counter-Trafficing agents and their attempts to confiscate your product.   Build international empires of drug cultivation, production, and distribution for eager markets with four types of bulk product.

Play across 74 drug hotspots from around the world. As a Druglord you will map trade routes, hire mercenaries, attack neighbors, and ball at international levels as your people complete successful transactions.  Evade trial, make  moves, defeat rival bosses, and score the most weight for victory!

—description from the publisher

Name: Legends of the Untamed West: Sunset at Silver Creek
Description:
You are in Nevada, the year is 1895. Rumors of foul play in the mining town of Silver Creek have led the local marshall to hire you to investigate. With the amount of money available in town, and with the remote location of the town, you would hardly be surprised that something is afoot. But you have little to go on, save the accidental drowning death of a local manager, and the word that witnesses are missing...

Sunset at Silver Creek is a complete programmed adventure set in the American West for solitaire or group play. The game includes an adventure booklet, game rules and playing pieces used to resolve the gun fights fought on the game map (also included).  It is the second in the Legends of the Untamed West series which uses a similar game system to Dark City Games' Legends of the Ancient World, which is based on the Fantasy Trip game system.
Families: Series: Legends of the Untamed West (Dark City Games)

Name: uDog
Description:
Using two standard decks of playing cards the players move marbles (the dogs) around a player board trying to be the first to return their dogs home from their kennels.  It is played in teams of two with rules for a two player variant with each player playing two colors.

uDog is a beautifully crafted wooden board game that will bring some old-fashioned fun back into your home. In a world that is dominated by screens, this very simple-to-learn, but highly strategic game offers a lot of competition and fun as you gather around the table. Part card game and part board game, this multiplayer challenge is simple to learn and exciting to master.

Name: Pharmacology Roulette
Description:
Push your luck polyhedral dice game.
—user summary

You and your friends are test subjects for Big Pharma! Will the experimental drugs cure what ails you or will send to an early grave? Pharmacology Roulette is a microgame designed by Lester Smith, where dice are drugs and you can play it safe or go for broke! Keep rolling until someone dies (in the game, relax) and see which patient is in best shape.
—description from the designer

Name: Leiden 1593: ライデン-チューリップ栽培の始まり- (Leiden 1593 – The Beginning of Tulip Cultivation)
Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago – Cities of Bronze
Description:
The islands of the Ghost Archipelago are covered in the ruins of ancient civilizations, but there is one group whose culture still thrives and whose power still grows - the Dricheans. Divided into many small kingdoms and city-states that wage near-constant war with snake-men, native tribes, and with each other, the Dricheans are renowned for the gleaming bronze of their weapons and armour, and their martial prowess. Organized and militaristic, these formidable warriors pose a new threat to adventurers exploring the Lost Isles.

This supplement for Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago examines the scattered realms of the Dricheans, presenting players with three new mini-campaigns featuring these bronze-armed warriors. Also included are additional rules for using Drichean Crew and Soldiers as well as guidelines for creating your own Drichean kingdoms.

Name: マーダーミステリー～約束の場所へ～ (Murder Mystery: To the Promised Place)
Description: ãƒžãƒ¼ãƒ€ãƒ¼ãƒŸã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒªãƒ¼ï½žç´„æŸã®å ´æ‰€ã¸ï½ž (Murder Mystery: To the Promised Place) is a murder mystery scenario for first-time players of such that can be played without needing a game master. Each player takes the role of someone related to the murder victim, and all of you will be interviewed to facilitate the investigation, but could the murderer be someone among you?

Name: Holland '44: Operation Market-Garden – Northern Scenario
Description:
Holland '44 - Northern Scenario Is a variant scenario for Holland '44: Operation Market-Garden by GMT Games, and covers the action of the 82nd and 1st Airborne Divisions, and the attempts by the 30th Corps to break through to Arnhem.

It is included in C3i Magazine, Issue #32.

Three new player aids, no new counters.

Name: BattleGoats: Reinforced
Description:
BattleGoats is a modern combination of Memory & War where players alternate turns in card battle to determine a winner using the highest number value. Every card in the game has a unique ability or modifier causing number values to change as the game goes on. The person with the last card in play wins. Rules are easy to pick up and games play in as little as 5-30 minutes.

BattleGoats: Reinforced is a full reprint + expansion which replaces the original base game entirely.  It is a standalone game, not just an expansion to the original.

Reinforced adds 1 new Hero, 21 Goats, 2 Equipment, and 2 Creatures to the mix! All copies of BattleGoats going forward will be Reinforced, meaning they will contain all 81 unique cards ready to battle out of the box. (Reinforced includes all of the original 55 cards, plus the 7 added via Kickstarter Stretch Goals.)

—description from the designer

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Soviet BMP Tank Expansion
Description:
The Soviet BMP (or Boyevaya Mashina Pekhoty) is a capable reconnaissance vehicle. The BMP-1 mounts a 73mm gun capable of knocking out close range targets whilst the more modern BMP-2 sports a more spacious turret and a 30mm automatic cannon easily capable of eliminating light vehicles and helicopters. Both have the capability to mount powerful anti-tank guided missiles.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Plastic BMP Tank
1x BMP-1 Tank card
1x BMP-2  Tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Humvee-TOW Tank Expansion
Description:
The Hummer, Humvee or HMMWV (High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle) is a modern take on the ubiquitous Jeep of World War II fame. The Humvee has a station located above the cab which is capable of mounting a variety of weapons including the awesome TOW (Tube launched Optically tracked Wire guided) anti-tank guided missile.

This pack contains:
2x Unassembled Plastic Humvee Tanks
2x Humvee-TOW Tank card
2x Hero cards
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – LAV Tank Expansion
Description:
When the United States Marine Corps wants to rapidly scout an area ahead of their unstoppable advances, they turn to the Light Armored Vehicle armed with a 25mm cannon in a fully rotating turret. When more firepower is needed the LAV-AT, with its ‘Hammerhead’ TOW guided missile launcher, will make any enemy tank crew think twice.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Plastic LAV-25 or LAV-AT Tank
1x LAV-AT Tank card
1x LAV-25 Tank card
1x Hero card
3x Crew cards
1x Upgrade card
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – M901 ITV Tank Expansion
Description:
Based on the M113 Armoured Personnel Carrier, the M163 VADS mounts a rapid firing multi-barrel cannon, allowing it to engage low flying aircraft and light vehicles with a lethal barrage of 20mm shells. The M113 has also been adapted into a fearsome tank killer in the form of the M901 ITV. The ITV uses its ‘Hammerhead’ TOW missile launcher to engage targets from hidden positions.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled M901 ITV or M163 VADS tank
1x M163 VADS Tank card
1x M901 Tank card
1x Hero card
1x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: TANKS: The Modern Age – M60 Patton Tank Expansion
Description:
Equipped with heavy armour and a powerful 105mm gun, the veteran M60 Patton has a proven combat record in conflicts all around the globe. It may not be the premier tank in the US Army anymore but superb tank crews are able to use the M60s’ protection and firepower to more than even the playing field and best their opponents.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled M60 Patton tank
1x M60 Patton Tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
Families: Game: TANKS – The Modern Age (Battlefront / GF9)

Name: Case #02
Description:
A dead body was found on a rainy night.
You have to reconstruct the crime to find out the murderer, and prevent further tragedies.

Case #02 is co-operative real-time deduction card game. Players need to exchange alibi cards for more clues. And have to find out the culprit who has no alibi. Players will take points if they successfully determined the culprit before any victims are killed.

This murder-themed game is a game of looking for two true criminals out of nine suspects in a limited time of three minutes. The hint for the perpetrator is limited to the number of the investigators, and not only the time but also the new victims (the people who thought they were suspects are killed by the criminals!) As the reasoning is delayed. It does not matter if you resolve the case beyond three minutes, but the only thing left is the wound.
And the opportunity to point out the killer is only once per game, regardless of the number of players and who is calling it! If this is a single chance, and you can not match the truth, then everyone will be defeated.

Name: Guild Ball: The Cook's Guild – Hell's Kitchen
Description:
The King’s Pud? Lass, if you’re not familiar with that cup, then there’s no hope for you. That battered piece of tin is older than any soul living, and most of the buildings and statues across the land besides. The name of the original king who commissioned it has long since passed from memory, just the same as his kingdom. Pah, the only thing that kept it safe during the war is that the bloody thing is nigh on worthless.

But the prestige to win it? Ah, now there’s a thing to be sought after, and savoured like a lean joint of venison. To a Chef, the King’s Pud is more important than even the Sovereign States, and the rewards twice as lucrative. Usually it’s only our own who compete for the cup, Chefs from all over travelling to the holder’s demesne to compete. But, now we’ve found ourselves in the big leagues, the field is open to all. So, you’d bloody well better shape up, girl. I don’t intend on letting anyone but our own get their filthy hands on the prize, and I won’t be too happy even if another Chef crew does!
                                                               - Wellington, Chef’s Guild Team Captain

The Cooks are the fourth of the Minor Guilds to reveal themselves, after the Ratcatchers, Falconers, and Navigators. Allied with the vicious Butcher's Guild, the Cook's ability to whip up a buffet of blood puts these two Guilds in perfect synchronisation.

Ready to cook something up, this set includes Wellington (Captain), Pepper (Mascot), Cinammon, Roast, Sugar, Spice, Roast Ham Ball, Stewing Pot Goal Token, Prep Table 3D Terrain Piece, Tokens and Health Dials.

Name: Dragon Class
Description:
The senior dragon students will have graduation test. Whose dragon will pass the test with flying colors?

Dragon Class is a deck building game dealing out 10 cards to each player. All players have 3 times to prepare and take the test.
Tests consists of 5 questions, depicted as different colors. The player who revealed the most cards in the same color as the test card earns the highest score.

The player with the highest score after taking all three tests wins the game.

Name: Guild Ball: The Navigator's Guild – Tales of the New World
Description:
“Aye, exotic and worldly they may be, but can they play Guild Ball as well as they can charm a crowd? Of that we’ll have to wait and see, like. But here’s a word of free advice, and the one thing you should never underestimate about them: they’re damn fast, even more slippery than the Fishermen, if you can believe that!”
- Lucky, Free Agent

Possessed by the same restless and inquisitive spirit as her crew, Windfinder is an enigmatic figure to most, her wild nature apparently at odds with the considered science of her trade. Yet, on the field, she is a helmsmistress without compare, coupling precise calculations and strategy with an exuberant unpredictability that leaves the opposition trailing in her wake.

Inspired by their captain’s leadership, the men and women of the Navigator’s Guild revel in unorthodox play, creating opportunities to score with sudden bursts of speed and agility. Even in adversity the Navigators are a challenge, turning terrain to their advantage or utilizing powerful abilities after suffering attrition from the enemy team.

Contents:
6 Pre-assembled Miniatures
  â€£ Windfinder
  â€£ Wander
  â€£ Horizon
  â€£ Fathom
  â€£ Azimuth
  â€£ Ebb
6 Stat Cards
1 Ball Token
1 3D Terrain Piece
1 Goalpost
Tokens & Health Dials for All Players

Name: Saboteur: Treasure Trove
Description:
Saboteur: Treasure Trove is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2018 Saboteur Belgian Championship. This card can be played with the base game of Saboteur and Saboteur: The Duel.

The card is played from the hand of one of the players, just like any other action card.

The procedure is as follows (after the player played the card):


     The player looks at the the top 5 cards of the discard-deck
     Of these five cards he chooses one and adds this card to his hand.
     The player's turn is over and can not take another card from the drawing deck.

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Forbidden Woods
Description:
Forbidden Woods is a big box expansion that brings this infested wilderness to life, represented by 12 new tiles, where you will be able to undertake 2 full campaigns, plus a side-mission Chapter, populated by 21 miniatures, including 5 types of Enemies and 2 Bosses!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rolling CUBES Do You Play English?
Description:
Rolling CUBES "Do You Play English?" is a game that allow you to have fun coming up with long sentences with the english words you rolled.

The box contains 13 wooden dice of different colours with words on them. Circled words are worth bonus points when used in a sentence.

You can play 3 different games (as standalone or as a tournament) and a variant based on YAHTZEE (playable solo). The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make the longest sentence possible, also trying to score bonuses (using all 13 dice for example).

Name: Rolling CUBES Parolandia
Description:
Rolling CUBES Parolandia is a game that allow you to have fun coming up with long sentences with the italian words you rolled.

The box contains 13 wooden dice of different colours with words on them. Circled words are worth bonus points when used in a sentence.

You can play 3 different games (as standalone or as a tournament) and a variant based on YAHTZEE (playable solo). The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make the longest sentence possible, also trying to score bonuses (using all 13 dice for example).

Name: Potion 21
Description:
Potion 21 combines roguelike elements such as randomly generated dungeons and permadeath with a game everyone already knows: blackjack, making it a great entry-level tabletop game.

Each round consists of constructing a dungeon and getting as far as you can without overdosing on potions (the equivalent of "busting" in blackjack) or being killed by monsters (the equivalent of having a lower score than the dealer).

As the game progresses you get better potions and raise your starting power, but when you die you lose everything and start the whole game over.

The first player to collect 3 immortality potions win the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: DreamEscape
Description:
Where even dreams may die!

DreamEscape is a card game hybrid of choose-your-path style narrative adventure and Cthulhu novella.

Great Cthulhu has trapped your sleeping mind in the Dreamlands. Your dream-self has shattered into multiple fragments, scattered throughout the dream world. It is your task to recover these lost fragments, unravel the story secrets and survive long enough to find the correct key and matching gate to escape and wake up!

To win you must avoid, adapt or overcome the many dangers of this nightmare world. Play one of six unique characters in this solo or 2 player semi co-operative RPG-like survival horror game.

Carefully manage your skills and resources, find rare items, gain secret knowledge and wield two uniquely powerful abilities - Deja vu and Lucid dreaming - to stay ahead of the minions of Cthulhu. Explore many hundreds of unique story encounters on your quest to recover the mind fragments and find a Dreamgate to let you wake from the nightmare. Failure will lead to insanity, locked forever in a dream within your own mind!

Dreamescape is a narrative exploration game driven by story card encounters. Each encounter offers roleplay-like choices that drive the game in divergent directions so the game evolves differently each time you play. Our novel keycode system triggers secret alternative storylines based on collected clues and items! Chance of success is based on your skills, equipment and lore gained so far, while repeated play rewards your experience as you uncover different parts of the story and memory of playing previously guides your choices!

The game offers multiple interwoven story arcs and plot lines to keep you occupied, with hidden puzzles, traps and lore to uncover... but all knowledge comes at a price. The more you experience, the greater your chances of being driven to insanity!

Live > Die > Replay! The Dream awaits...

—description from the publisher

Name: Mauern Babylon
Description:
Wooden made abstract game. Players start in their corner area of an 8x8 grid with their hut and 3 square pieces around it. In your turn, you place either an adjacent square piece or you put it onto another square piece (of an opponent as well) if it is adjacent to you. When all pieces are built, the player or team with the most spaces controlling (including empty ones that are only adjacent to him and maybe the border) wins. 
The advanced version introduces male and female meeples and for each player another 2 huts. If you  place a piece onto another, you may add a meeple and put it in your hut or you can move one in front of your hut. Alternatively, you may move one ore more of your meeples on the same piece anywhere but only changing once the height by one step. You may fight another meeples of the same sex by throw of a die and you may marry one of the opposite sex and found a new hut. In the end, you multiply the controlled spaces by the number of your huts and add one point for each unmarried meeple of your own.

—user summary

Name: Feed Fuzzy
Description:
Throw the 2 dice and choose the acorns from your supply that correspond to the number and colour indicated on the dice. Feed Fuzzy the Squirrel now! Be the first player to feed all your acorns to Fuzzy and win the game! You'll love this lively number-crunching game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Halfling Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
This set comes with a double-sided pitch to enjoy crushing opposing teams on two variations of the Halfling home turf. Also included are two double-sided dugouts to match the board.

Each Pitch and Dugout set also comes with special rules on the back for playing on that pitch board to make them truly unique.

Name: Don't Drop The Donut
Description: Throw the die and carefully remove a stick of the colour indicated on the die. The sticks come in several widths. The widest sticks are the hardest to remove, but they count for the most points. Take a deep breath and remember... don’t drop the donut!

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #5
Description: Issue 5 of the official Blood Bowl Journal is here and focuses on Halfling teams. This jam-packed issue includes not only the background, rules and rosters for Halfling teams, but also the 10 Star Players who are available for them to hire. There is also a tactics article for Halfling teams as well as a number of additional extras and columns.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Halfling Team Card Pack
Description:
A deck of Blood Bowl reference cards for Halfling teams such as the Greenfield Grasscutters. In addition to a number of player datacards for each Halfling player and their available Star Players, there is a selection of blank player cards that can be used to create or keep track of your own players for your team.

There is also a team roster card that will help you keep track of your team’s progression, with a match record on the reverse side.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Match Inducements Card Pack
Description:
Inducements! They can be literally game-changing, but how often have you reached the end of the second half and realised you forgot all about an Inducement that you paid hard-earned GP for? This deck of 26 reference cards will help you keep track of them during your games and read the rules without breaking up the action. Plus, you’ll get a handy set of double-sided reference cards to boot!

CONTENTS
– 11 Inducements that can be used by any team: Bloodweiser Keg, Bribes, Extra Team Training, Wandering Apothecaries, Horatio X. Schottenheim, Hireling Sports-Wizard, Frog, Specialist Assistant Coaches, Temp Agency Cheerleaders, Weather Mage & Halfling Master Chef.
– 10 team-specific Inducements: Kari Coldsteel, Fink Da Fixer, Papa Skullbones, Galandril Silverwater, Krot Shockwhisker, Chaos Sorcerer, Druchii Sports Sorceress, Plague Doctor, Horticulturalist of Nurgle & Igor.
– Scatter template / Throw-in template
– Passing chart / Agility table
– Weather table / Weather conditions tracker
– Kick-off table
– Team Card / Match Record

This card pack comes loaded with reference cards for Blood Bowl's many inducements. No more flipping through various Spike journals or Almanacs just to remind yourself what your inducements do. Rules and an FAQ for using inducements are located in the Blood Bowl 2018 Almanac on Page 135.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Willow Rosebark – Star Player
Description:
Star Player for Blood Bowl that can be recruited exclusively in Halfling, Amazon, or Wood Elf teams.

Willow Rosebark is a unique Dryad with the skills Dauntless, Loner, Sidestep, and Thick Skull.

Rules and an expanded player profile for Willow Rosebark can be found on page 39 of the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Athelorn Avengers – Wood Elf Blood Bowl Team
Description:
From the publisher:

The Athelorn Avengers exemplify everything that makes Wood Elves some of the best teams in Blood Bowl: stunning speed and agility, unexpected savagery and natural talent. Star Players like Jordell Freshbreeze and Gloriel Summerbloom have become household names for Blood Bowl fans everywhere. Wood Elf teams are incredibly popular, as they're known to put on an impressive show – they're just as likely to (literally) dance circles around their rivals as they are to get smashed in (literally) spectacular fashion. They play the game better than just about anyone else, and they look stunning while they're at it.

Wood Elves hit hard and fast, but they're not known for their endurance and resilience, alas. They’re the proverbial glass dagger, but in the hands of a skilled coach they can produce impressive results. If you're content to scrape by with minimal effort, this isn't the team for you – it takes finesse and skill to win games, but when you succeed, you know you've earned it. For their part, Wardancers are amongst the most impressive starting players in the game, all your Wood Elf players start with at least 7 Movement, and they have access to one of the wildest collections of Star Players to be found anywhere.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you need to assemble the Athelorn Avengers, a Wood Elf team for use in games of Blood Bowl, containing 2 Catchers, 2 Throwers, 2 Wardancers and 6 Line Elves, plus a roster sheet. Also included are a transfer sheet, 2 turn markers featuring a Wood Elf motif, 3 thematic balls, and 14 Citadel 32mm Round bases featuring holes in which to place the ball.

The rules to use Wood Elf teams in your games of Blood Bowl can be found in Spike! Journal 6.

Name: Battle of the Ages
Description: A trivia game wherein children are pitted against adults. Children have a unique deck of easier trivia questions and adults are given one with harder questions. A die is rolled each turn to get extra points, steal points or miss a turn. First to 15 points wins.

Name: Night of the Wererabbit
Description:
Do you like kittens that explode? This is not it.

Do you like short statured fantasy types who like to battle monsters?

Well we've got the monsters but no Elves or any magic (not counting Cousin Cleatus's moonshine, that could be magic or a curse). However, what we do have is plenty of liquor, bad judgment, and a whole lot of firepower!

Welcome to Night of the Wererabbit the number one game about money, monsters, and moonshine. Prepare for a wild and crazy ride, all the while trying to survive the horde of monsters and even more brutal hangovers.

Now before you go asking whether we've been hitting the moonshine too much the answer is yes. The other question you might be asking is what in the world are we talking about. Well buckle up buttercup, and let us lay some know how on you.

Night of the Wererabbit is a card game for 2-5 players (unless you buy the expansion pack for up to 8 players) where your objective is to fight monsters, collect the bounties for killing them, and reach the goal of $10,000. With $10,000 you can buy whatever your redneck heart desires; A NASCAR commemorative plate collection, a new whiskey jug, or getting Uncle Maynard out of jail, anything you want, embrace your inner redneck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Danmark Rundt
Description:
Each player gets 16 Danish cities/towns to visit: 6 cities that all have to visit and 10 random cities/towns. To move around, roll a die and move the rolled number of dots unless you roll a six, in which case you draw a question card. If you answer the question correctly, you get to move a number of dots forward (related to the difficulty of the question).
You win by getting to all your 16 cities/towns first.

—user summary

Name: Trolley Problems
Description:
It’s a classical ethical problem: A trolley is hurtling towards a junction. 
On one side, an astronaut and five lawyers. On the other, the oldest person in the world and a 3-legged dog. 
Which direction do you send the trolley?

Prove you’re the greatest philosopher of all time by presenting the other players with divisive hypotheticals.

In Trolley Problems, you are setting up moral dilemmas for everyone else to vote on. 
You earn points by setting up difficult problems. As a voter, you get a point for being in the majority. 
The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Seal The Ghosts
Description:
Seal The Ghosts is an action game using some paper cups with a colored seal.
The goal of the game is to seal as many ghosts as possible and to minimize ghosts in your hand when the game is over."Ghost" is a paper cup, and "Seal" means to put the cup inside of "Ring for Sealing". You can put "Ghost" on the other ghost, but if you want to do it, there must be at least one ghost of the same color under it to be placed on top of it.
The player who sealed all his hand-held ghosts is not the winner, and the one who broke the sealed ghosts is not the loser, but the player who has less ghost in hand at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary

Name: BrainBox: First Colours
Description:
This BrainBox title has been developed to support very young children in early colour recognition. The front of the card features 3 images, each one in a different colour. Children must look at the images and try to remember all of the colours (the words are also shown), then they turn over the card and each image is shown as an outline only. The question asks "What colour?" and children have to say the colour of each of the objects they have just seen.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: Royal Gardeners
Description:
The Queen requires a new gardener. She will assign a small portion of her royal garden to each candidate to decorate them with her favorite flowers. The gardener who manages to please her majesty with most beautiful flower arrangements, will become Queen's new royal gardener!

Royal Gardeners game is designed for 2 to 5 players, ages 7 and up, with games lasting about 15-25 minutes.

Each player will get one portion of Queen's garden with certain number of spaces. On each of those spaces, players may plant flowers of 6 different colors. Players will also collect cards that represents different goals, each providing certain amount of victory points. At the end of the game, player with most victory points is the winner of the game.

Each turn, a player may choose either to plant flowers or pick a goal card from the middle of the table. When planting flowers, player must choose 2 different colors of any kind, and then, him and all other players, must plant those flowers in their portion of the garden. Flowers must be planted next to each other so it will not be possible to make a perfect arrangement of colors in the garden.

The tactics and the decision that players have to make on their turn is: weather to plant colors they need, in order to fulfill the goal cards, or to skip planting in order to take another goal card that can potentially bring him more victory points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: ボブジテンその２ (Bob Jiten 2)
Description:
User summary
ãƒœãƒ–ã‚¸ãƒ†ãƒ³ãã®ï¼’ (Bob Jiten 2) is a standalone expansion of ãƒœãƒ–ã‚¸ãƒ†ãƒ³ (Bob Jiten)

Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that a new character Dave is introduced. While Dave is active, question master may not say anything. Only gestures are allowed to convey the word.

Name: ボブジテンきっず (Bob Jiten Kids)
Description:
User summary
ãƒœãƒ–ã‚¸ãƒ†ãƒ³ãã£ãš (Bob Jiten Kids) is a standalone expansion of Bob Jiten.

Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that new character Natasha is introduced. While Natasha is active, question master may not say color words either.

Name: ボブジテンその３ (Bob Jiten 3)
Description:
User summary
ãƒœãƒ–ã‚¸ãƒ†ãƒ³ãã®ï¼“ (Bob Jiten 3) is a standalone expansion of Bob Jiten.

Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that new character George is introduced. While George is active, question master may not say hiragana words either. Virtually only nouns are allowed.

Name: Teenage Morphing Superheroes
Description:
The peaceful school day was interrupted, yet again, with another Super Monster spotted marching toward our city! Of course, only the team of 5 Teenage Morphing Superheroes can stand on its way! They must try to stop the Monster before it reaches the city and unleash the devastation upon its innocent population!

Each round a card with the monster attack will be revealed. Players will secretly play cards in order to try to defend from Monster attacks. Players are not allowed to say what cards they are playing. When all cards are revealed, collectively they must beat the correct type of attack that the monster is threatening with.

Instead of fighting, players may play "selfie" cards. That way, a player is slacking in combat but will earn him a victory point. At the end of the game, the player with greatest popularity on social networks is the winner of the game, or, if Super Monster reaches the city, all players lose.

This is a semi-coop game, where players must balance between fighting monster (for greater good) or be selfish and collect victory points, and try to persuade others that "they really need to beat the monster this time".

Name: わたしのボブジテン (Watashi no Bob Jiten)
ボブジテンぷらす (Bob Jiten Plus)
ボブジテンその２ぷらす (Bob Jiten 2 Plus)
Dead of Winter: Giggles
Description:
Plaid Hat Games 10th anniversary promo. It was included in the Asmoplay Adventure Box (July 2019).

This promo includes a new character called Giggles, the Birthday Clown. This comprises a standee, character card and relevant Crossroads card.

Part of the Dead of Winter series.

Name: Elemental Trunk Man
Description:
ã‚¨ãƒ¬ãƒ¡ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ«ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¯ãƒžãƒ³ (Elemental Trunk Man) is a Japanese game, following up from Time Trunk Man. You are an Elemental Trunk Man, a time-traveling agent, who unblocks treasure boxes collected over time and takes out treasures. With the help of the elemental spirits, we will unlock the seal of the treasure chest and aim to open more treasure chests than our rivals!

We will start from the point where you can communicate with the four spirits of Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth. 
In order to open the sealed treasure chest, we communicate with the spirits to gain mana and unseal the treasure chest. You can earn points of contribution by the degree of contribution.

There are two things you can do in your turn! 
-Summoning spirits (increases the spirits that can be communicated) 
-Unseal the seal of the treasure box (Communicates with the spirits, obtains mana and unseals the seal of the treasure box)

The spirits are wooden tokens of the four elements. On your turn, you shake up your set and throw them. The pieces that land upright can be used to trigger your actions. The more tokens you collect, the better chance of success.

There are some treasure chests where bonus points can be added to the contribution points by releasing the seal quickly, and by removing the final seal. It is important to have the bonus points at the end of the game and the timing of releasing it. However, if you do not summon the spirits, it will become difficult later.

Summoning spirits requires a deck build idea of â€‹â€‹how to combine the spirits. It's fun to think of your own combination. In addition, it may be important to change the combination depending on the situation of the treasure chest."

Publisher's summary
New sense game of "token build" x "role action" x "placement"! You are a treasure chest unlocker "Elemental Trunk Man". With the help of spirits, unlock the seal of the treasure chest.

The game starts with four spirits pieces of fire, water, earth, and wind. And, shake those spirit pieces like a dice every time. As a result, you can gain spirit power if the spirit piece is standing up. You use this spirit power to unseal the seal of the treasure chest.
You can also increase spirits pieces by using spirit power. Create your own strategy by combining 11 kinds of spirit pieces.

Name: Hannibal ad Portas
Description:
Hannibal ad Portas is the first title of the One Page Games series: it’s a quick historical game where you play the role of Hannibal on his march from Spain to Italy, where he will meet the Roman Army at Cannae (216BC).

One Page Games (1PG) have been designed with the objective of being “light” games in terms of:

     Time 
     Table space
     Cost


I’ve found it more and more difficult to find the time to study a full-featured game while often I’ve got a 30 minutes break in the daily routine: 1PG have been designed to fill this small interval. Rules are easy and short enough to provide a quick but interesting gaming session: from this perspective 1PG are great for a flight since they perfectly fit on the small space of a plane seat.

Each 1PG must follow two design rules:

     All the components for the game can be placed on a single A4 sheet of paper (no counter, no dice).
     The same deck of 18 cards is used by all the games to provide randomness without the need of using dice.


In addition, you will only need a pencil and a rubber.

—description from the designer

Name: The Battle of Britain: Adlerangriff
Description:
In the summer of 1940, almost a year after the outbreak of The Second World War, Great Britain stood alone in Europe against a triumphant Germany. Adlerangriff is the German word meaning Attack of the Eagles, the assault on south-east England by The Luftwaffe which was to be undertaken prior to the invasion of the British Isles and this term was used by the Germans to define what the British referred to as The Battle of Britain.

Whilst Fighter Command R.A.F was spread over airfields in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Island, only those squadrons in the south-east would be able to interfere with an invasion which, it was expected, would take place along the south coast between Dover and Weymouth. The battle will, therefore, be fought over the area covered by No 11 Group. If the Luftwaffe can permanently destroy the Sector Stations and Airfields of No 11 Group, thus immobilizing the fighters that use them, the invasion can be undertaken.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Vikings Risk: The Conquest of Europe
Description:
LET THE VIKING AGE BEGIN! The continent of Europe has faced many battles in the past, but none as brutal as what is about to become a 250-year conquest. Ragnar Lothbrok, disenchanted with his chieftain's progress, decides to cross the oceans by boat and discover new, richer civilisations. Now it's your turn to engage in combat and seek to conquer this new world alongside him. Play as one of five fully customised Viking tribes, including uniquely influential Viking longship game pieces, as you try to invade and capture the nine regions of Europe. With special Cards of the Gods to help boost your forces or ruin your plans, and special Raid cards to capture strategic strongholds and gain new warriors, this edition of Risk is an epic battle for control of Europe... and its vast riches. See you in Valhalla!

—from publisher's website

Name: Courier Chaos
Description:
Zip through town in your delivery truck to make as much cash as possible before your rival couriers. Every completed delivery reported to the office builds up your pay cheque and puts you one step ahead in the race to become the ruler of the mail courier empire.
Courier Chaos is a pick up and deliver game where Couriers race to deliver packages to the citizens of their town. Couriers must plan their route carefully to avoid traffic jams. The Courier with the highest pay cheque over $300 is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Fyreslayers
Description:
Battletome: Fyreslayers is the updated guide to fielding a Fyreslayer army for Age of Sigmar 2nd Edition.

This hardback book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules for fielding your Fyreslayer army in games of Age of Sigmar, as well as rules for building a Fyreslayer warband in Path to Glory.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cleared to Land
Description:
Cleared to Land is an exciting and dynamic card game. The objective of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards has won the round. The remaining players count the value of the cards left in their hand, and the amount is allocated to the winner of the round as victory points. When a player has 500 victory points or more, the game is over. That player has won the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Barty Crouch Jr. & Death Eaters Expansion
Description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

The Barty Crouch Jr. & Death Eaters box contains the following:


    4 High Quality Resin Miniatures ready to paint and assemble
        Barty Crouch Jr.
        3 new Death Eaters
    
    4 30mm Plastic Bases
    4 Character Cards 
    2 Spell Cards
    5 Artefact Cards
    1 Potion Card



    1 Wizarding Wars rulebook (tournament rules)
    15 Duelling Cards


From the publisher: The Wizarding Wars are an exciting new way to play the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game. These official events allow players to compete against each other in a fast, fun and furious day of gaming, proving themselves the ultimate champion of the Wizarding World...

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Death Battletome – Flesh-Eater Courts
Description:
Battletome: Flesh-Eater Courts is the  guide to fielding a Flesh-Eater army for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules for fielding your Flesh-Eater army in games of Age of Sigmar.

—description from the publisher

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Barty Crouch Sr. & Aurors Expansion
Description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

The Barty Crouch Sr. & Aurors box contains the following:


    4 High Quality Resin Miniatures ready to paint and assemble
        Barty Crouch Sr.
        3 Aurors
    
    4 30mm Plastic Bases
    4 Character Cards 
    4 Spell Cards
    3 Artefact Cards
    2 Potion Card



    1 Wizarding Wars rulebook (tournament rules)
    15 Duelling Cards


From the publisher: The Wizarding Wars are an exciting new way to play the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game. These official events allow players to compete against each other in a fast, fun and furious day of gaming, proving themselves the ultimate champion of the Wizarding World...

Name: Jeanne d'Arc: la bataille d'Orléans
Description:
The Hundred Years War rages on; the English are laying siege to Orléans, a strategic city between the north and the south of the Loire, between those territories annexed by the English and those held by the French Dauphin.

Despite the English forces, Joan of Arc manages to get into the city. The inhabitants and the troops rally around her. You are one of Joan of Arc’s Companions, like Dunois, De Laval and La Hire, and your aim is to distinguish yourself as much as possible during this battle.

Show yourself around enemy fortresses, confer with Joan or the Dauphin, deploy your troops and be ready when Joan launches her attack.

Aim of the game:
You are Joan’s Companions and your common enemy are the English. To liberate the fortresses, you will need to cooperate.
But you need to know that only one will be the winner : The Companion who gathers the more prestige during the battle.
He will have the great honor to accompany Joan and the Dauphin to Reims for the coronation.
So be vigilant, place your troops at the right place and at the right time to shine more and acquire more prestige than the other Companions.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Mystery at the Lux Museum
Description:
Something is amiss in the Lux Museum and we need your help to crack the case!  Mystery at the Lux Museum is a cooperative game for 1-6 players in which players use clues to solve puzzles and ultimately solve a perplexing mystery.  Physical assets such as maps, museum guides, stamps, model statues, ciphers, pictures and more are sent with the game in order to assist the user.

This game is meant to be a family game in which kids and adults come together to solve the puzzles.  The recommended age for kids is 6-12.  The typical duration of the game is 1-2 hours.

—description from the designer

Name: Copenhagen: Nyhavn
Description:
The Multicolor Tiles are the first two Queenies (single expanion modules) for Copenhagen. They are separately labeled, but they are packaged together, and will only be sold as a pair.

To get a multi-color tile, you have to discard cards in the exact color combination of the tile. You can get a one card discount if, when placing the tile, one of the squares is touching a previously placed tile of the same color (as normal), but you can only get this discount once, and only of the color it is touching (if it is touching more than one color, you can decide where to get the discount).

The size three tiles are added to the game in addition to the normal tiles, whereas the size 5 tiles replace the normal size 5 tiles, keeping the competition for them high. The size 5 tiles also feature completely different shapes for an new challenge.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Albus Dumbledore Expansion
Description:
Considered to be the most powerful wizard of his time, Albus Wulfric Percival Brian Dumbledore – to give him his full name – was the headmaster of Hogwarts for a period that encompassed both of Voldemort’s attempts to take over the Wizarding World.

This finely detailed Albus Dumbledore resin model depicts the Hogwarts headmaster at the height of his powers. Wielding the Elder Wand, Dumbledore can be mounted on a regular 30mm base, or placed on an impressive centrepiece large base, representing Dumbledore using the powerful Firestorm incantation, with which he vanquished the sinister Inferi at the Crystal Cave.

The set includes two Character Cards, one for each base type, giving you more tactical options when choosing Dumbledore as part of your Group. The Albus Dumbledore box also contains a new scenario, artefact card, and complete assembly instructions.

-- From the publisher.

Name: Crazy Burger
Description:
Crazy Burger is a game about making hamburgers and stopping other players from doing the same.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME:
The first player to get a full set of seven cards featuring all hamburger ingredients wins the game.

CARDS:
There are 7 ingredient cards and 10 special cards. Each card is in the deck 6 times. Players begin with a starting hand of 7 cards.

GENERAL RULES:
At the beginning of each turn take a card, either from the deck or from the top of the discard pile. If the player doesn’t want to draw a card they can pass.

At the beginning of a turn, a player may draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile. Then they can play cards from their hands. The special cards are used to attack other players, mostly forcing them to discard or give away hand cards. A player who loses their last hand card is eliminated from the game.

Name: Onitama: Sensei's Path et Way of the Wind
Description: Compilation of the 2 expansions - Sensei’s Path and Way of the Wind.

Name: Machi Koro: The Harbor & Millionaire's Row Expansions
Description: Compatible with the newest edition of Machi Koro: 5th Anniversary Edition, this compilation box contains the expansions Machi Koro: Millionaire's Row and Machi Koro: Harbor

Name: Seven Days to the River Rhine
Description:
Seven Days to the River Rhine is a set of fast play rules simulating armoured combat during the 1980's in Europe when the Cold War between the NATO alliance and Soviet led Warsaw Pact could easily have turned Hot.

The rules cater for games with lots of armour and infantry and other supporting weapons in any scale. The mechanics are remarkably simple and the method of activation presents players with tricky tactical decisions to ponder creating a sense of high tension and drama.

The rules cater for figures or vehicle models of scales between 1/300 6mm and 1/56 28mm.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Melbourne Edition
Description:
On 25 June 1847, Melbourne was declared a city by letters patent of Queen Victoria.

By 1865, Melbourne had become Australia's most populous city, at a time when consumer confidence was high, credit was easy to access and steep increases were seen in the price of land.

Today, Melbourne is one of the most vibrant and liveable cities in the world and this edition of Monopoly captures the magic of this unique city.

Begin your journey in one of the famous laneways and marvel at the street art at Hosier Lane, or grab a bite to eat at Hardware Lane. Browse the outlets at Queen Victoria Market and cheer on your favourite horse at the Melbourne Cup at Flemington Racecourse. Take a tour of Old Melbourne Gaol, or surf a wave at Bells Beach. Kick your Sherrin football around Etihad Stadium or watch a 20/20 match at the MCG.

All these iconic sites and more have been immortalised in this edition of Melbourne Monopoly and you have the chance to own them all!

So locate your favourite Melbourne hotspots and roll the dice to begin your property building empire in this new version of the classic Monopoly game!

Name: Nishikigoi
Description:
The design of the Koi ponds may have a great effect on the Nishikigoi’s health and well-being. The Emperor has chosen you to build perfectly suitable ponds, so the carps can reach their highest potential. To do so, you must assign each Koi colony its proper place.

In each round, players have to cooperate assigning a different group of carps splitting the pond. It’s important to optimise the area to shelter the most colonies.

In turn you need to build the perfect home to the colony.

First, determine the perfect pond rolling the 3 dice. These dice show you the exact number of nishikigoi you must have inside a pond area when it’s closed.

To shape the pond, each player must play a Pond card (placed partially other cards) in turn order until a pond area is completely (the wather lilies line is closed). To do so, the card can be partially placed over other cards in play (never underneath).

When the pond is closed, if the exact number of nishikigoi of each colour matches the dice, remove 5 of the played cards and put them at the bottom of the deck. The rest are set aside to show you have built a perfect pond area.

The game ends when all cards have been played. There is no more space in the imperial pond and it’s time to evaluate how well you have done.

—description from the publisher

Name: Core Space: Deluxe Rulebook
Description:
This deluxe, 176-page hardback rulebook contains everything you need to play Core Space in one place. It is a companion product to the Starter Set and other associated products, expanding the game with advanced rules, background and customisation. It includes:

Core Rules
        A comprehensive guide to the components and rules needed to play the game.
    NPCs
        Full rules for the AI-controlled Galactic Corps, Security, Criminal Gangers and Civilians.
    Missions
        Objectives, maps, difficulty settings, and everything you need to create your own stories.
    Campaigns
        Turn your games into one continuous story with rules for Extraction, Advancement and Trading.
    The Perseus Arm Campaign
        10 narrative missions in which the crews of the Ion Hope and Black Maria must stop a Purge invasion.
    Advanced Rules
        Plenty of exciting new ways to add a twist to your games, with a Game Master, new terrain, Trader injuries, and lots more!
    Character Creation
        Detailed rules for designing your own Traders, Classes, NPCs and even new enemies!
    The Core Space Universe
        The background and history of the characters, locations, and the deadly threat of the Purge.
    Behind the Scenes
        An insight into the making of Core Space.

—description from the publisher

Name: Core Space: Purge – Outbreak
Description:
Purge: Outbreak is an expansion for Core Space that reinforces the Purge with the menacing Gatherers and the lethal Annihilator. Ramp up the difficulty and defeat these colossal constructs in a series of thrilling new missions, and then add them to your regular games with the new Event Cards. Just don’t let them take you alive!

New terrain infests your boards with living biomass, and new equipment such as the Mother’s Venom will give your crew new ways to survive!

Contents: 1 Purge Annihilator Miniature / 1 Purge Mother Miniature / 5 Purge Spider Miniatures / 2 Character Boards / 3 Annihilator Status Inserts / 2 Annihilator Upgrade Counters / 5 Spider Counters / 3 Reward Counters / 1 ‘Mother’s Venom’ Equipment Token / 24 Infestations / 2 Cell Walls / Plasma Reactor / Auto-Doc / Console / 1 Mission Briefing and Rules Booklet

—description from the publisher

Name: Core Space: Cygnus Crew
Description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the massive Chit and the veteran Hunter. Get to know Captain Sondar and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Bio-Tag Rifle.

Contents: 4 Trader Miniatures / 4 Character Boards / 4 Class Boards / 1 Ship Board / 3 Event Cards / 11 Equipment Tokens / 1 Mission Briefing and Rules Booklet

—description from the publisher

Name: Miremarsh: Game Designer Promo Hex Tile
Description:
A promo hex tile available during the UKGE 2018

Encounter:

Spend a star symbol (blue dice) to switch any two tiles of the same level including anything on them

Name: Core Space: Poseidon Crew
Description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the skilled Hoskins and the dependable Thoman. Get to know Captain Teelac and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Jump Pack.

—description from the publisher

Name: Core Space: Skylark Crew
Description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the Machine Mac and the augmented Marlowe. Get to know Captain Weaver and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Shield Pod.

—description from the publisher

Name: Core Space: Yamato Crew
Description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the Merg Brutus and his handler Ellen. Get to know Captain Weis and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Empathic Cuffs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Solidarisk
Description:
The game Solidarisk aims to raise awareness of business creation and the social and solidarity economy through the CIGALES (Club d'Investisseurs pour une Gestion Alternative et Locale de l'Épargne Solidaire) venture capital investment club. During the game, each team (from 2 to 4 people) plays the role of members of a CIGALES club that will decide whether or not to support the business projects submitted to them. Companies created or supported will be faced with the various hazards of the economic world (crisis, unemployment, competition, innovation, regulation etc.), which will spark debate between all players and require choices from them.

All aspects of the economic life of a company are thus brushed aside in a fun way and can be the means for the entrepreneur to rebound, develop and bring knowledge to the players.

The game is based on real business projects.

The game Solidarisk was created in 1999 by the Fédération des CIGALES on the initiative of AESOPUS, a European program, and has been reissued in partnership with the University of Poitiers.

—user summary

Name: Core Space: Purge Reinforcements
Description:
This booster pack for Core Space bolsters your Purge forces with Harvesters, Devastators, and even an Assassin and a Live One. These are perfect for larger games or just when you want more of a challenge, and the new Event Cards will seamlessly integrate them into your missions.

—description from the publisher

Name: kiSabadulos: The colours of Easter
Description:
DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The third  in the series is: " The colours of Easter" where the group has to obtain coloured pencils via completing different Easter-themed tasks, so that they can fix the currently black and white colouring page that represents Easter.

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 8 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 60 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.

Name: Zero Seven
Description:
Zero Seven is a psychological quiz game where you need to answer correctly the questions that mostly begin with the words «How many...». Any answer must be a whole number from 0 to 7, and the players bid for the number they consider correct with a combination of their number cards so that their sum equals the estimated answer. The players can’t use bidding cards they’ve placed as bets before, so they have to plan carefully which cards they should keep and which ones they are ready to sacrifice to get the full hand back. There is also an “Elementary!” rule which allows to profit from all other players answering correctly. Most of the times the winner is not the one who reads a lot of books, but the one who is the most cunning!

—description from the publisher

Name: Royal Marriage
Description:
Royal Marriage is a solitaire game played with a standard 52-card poker deck, dating from the 19th century or earlier. Players seek to reunite the Queen of Hearts, at one end of the deck, with her King, at the other, by eliminating all other cards.

To set up a game, the King and Queen of Hearts are removed from a deck, which is then shuffled. Afterwards, the King is placed on the bottom and the Queen placed on top. Cards are dealt, one by one, from the top of the deck and played next to the Queen, forming a row that allows all cards to be seen at once.

Cards can be removed one or two at a time, but only when they are bookended by two cards of either the same suit or rank. If all cards save the Queen and King are eliminated, the game is won; if cards remain and no further moves can be made, the game is lost.

Strategy comes in the form of hand management, deciding which cards to eliminate and when. Immediately discarding cards whenever possible is likely to lead to a loss; rather, cards that can easily be eliminated later -- such as those of the same suit as the King and Queen -- are often better to keep, in case they can be paired up later with other cards to eliminate some stubborn holdouts. Success or failure often depends on which cards the player can manage to hold on to for later use.

Royal Marriage can be played on a table or entirely in-hand. To play the latter, the King is placed on the top of the deck face-down, while the Queen is placed on top of the King face-up. Cards are then dealt from the bottom of the deck onto the Queen, and fanned out to show available moves.

—user summary

Name: World of Snooker
Description:
A statistical simulation game by Roberto Chiavini focusing on the Snooker World Championships.  Initial releases allow replaying of the 1927-30 championships, or the 1977-80 championships.

Every player in the competition is rated with an Effectiveness value (representing points scored through the tournament) and a Tournament rating (representing how far the player advanced, and providing the opportunity for bonus dice each round.)

Each frame players tests their Tournament rating, then throw a number of 10-sided dice based on that result.  The total showing on the dice is added to the Effectiveness value and the higher total wins the frame.

Name: Fault!
Description:
In Fault!, you are one of several startup companies in a dangerously misguided competition to determine who gains the exclusive mineral rights to the famously rich Tremor Gulch mine. To impress the judges, you'll gather gems to complete contracts for points and powers, and you'll vie over achievements which transform into trophies.

By hiring the right combinations of miners and backing them with carefully managed resources and planning, you're certain to undermine your competition. But be careful - if you mine too aggressively, you'll earn fault from the supervisors, which carries steep fines now or deeper penalties if ignored. And if you or your competitors mine too greedily, the reinforcements in the mine will start to break - when a mine tile loses its last reinforcement, it caves in, taking miners with it.

Combining resource management and efficiency planning with direct player interaction, Fault! is a truly unique hybrid of gaming styles. Whether you're skillfully navigating the maze of the mine to excavate carefully selected stones or wildly flinging dynamite and grabbing every exploded element, you're sure to unearth stories to remember.

—description from the publisher

Name: Army Group North
Description:
"DAMOS: Army Group North" is game 1 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames from our new Destroy All Monsters Operational Series (DAMOS) that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are Divisions along with Army HQs and some Air Units.

DAMOS is a highly interactive and unique, original take on operational/strategic maneuvers during WW2. There is almost 0 player downtime for either player. DAMOS brings mechanics such as combat postures, reactions, and exploitation into the 21st century with a brand new take on some old favorite mechanics.

Army Group North covers Von Leeb’s ascent into the Baltic states in his attempt to blitzkrieg Leningrad. While performing extraordinarily well, a long drawn out siege resulted which eventually led to a German withdraw. AGN gives players the chance to do one better than Von Leeb, with the other two games in the series, the player may even borrow a Panzergruppe or 2 from AGC…

WEIGHT: 5/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGC and AGS

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Hard West: The Board Game
Description:
It's a horror strategy game settled in the old wild west. In a world where everyone is hostile and making allies is not easy. Luckily there are still some people eager to join your cause. Doesn't mean really that they're good folks. They just have their own business too. You and your team of gunslingers will struggle in intense gunfights obtaining own goals. The world of Hard West is full of bandits, demons and other supernatural beings.

This is a game that requires strategic thinking, clever planning, and exemplary execution to succeed. To triumph, players must explore dangerous locations, discover and defeat enemies, and collect equipment and treasures. Hard West is a board game that can support between 2-6 players. Is a great social game that's quite easy to learn but really quite difficult to master. You'll be surprised to see how your friends around the table can easily pick up the rules.

Day or night? Our cardboard platform has been designed to meet all your requirements. Each site has been adjusted to various scenarios that we have prepared just for you. So what? Western or horror? The choice is yours. There are 12 different figures for a base version of the game. Each has own distinguished features. Players can choose between cowboys, adventurers and demons. Each character has set of special forces and abilities. Inside the box you will find more than 50 special cards that are insane game changers. Many of them work as a unique ability that allow you to take action in form of response on your opponents turn what makes it hard and unpredictable.

—description from the publisher

Name: Army Group Center
Description:
"DAMOS: Army Group Center" is a World War II wargame, issue 2 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are divisions along with army HQs and some air units.

DAMOS is a brand new, unique take on operational scale WW2 gaming that features almost 0 player downtime. DAMOS takes tried and true wargaming conventions and repackage them forcing longtime grognards to re-approach how they think of operational tactics. Units can react, choose combat postures, and get huge exploit opportunities when they overkill an enemy.

Army Group Center covers Von Bock’s relentless drive on Moscow. Logistics must be maintained as the German army advances while the Soviets must stem the flow of Panzers as best as possible. The German player has the choice of sending a Panzer Army south as Hitler ordered historically, or keep them with AGC as the generals wanted in order to take Moscow.

WEIGHT: 6/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGN and AGS.

—description from the designer

Name: Army Group South
Description:
"DAMOS: Army Group South" is game 3 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are divisions for the Germans and Division to Army sized for the Russians.

DAMOS is a brand new, unique take on operational scale WW22 combat. With almost 0 player downtime, DAMOS is highly interactive between possible reactions, combat postures, and other mechanics. DAMOS takes many well-known wargaming conventions and repackages them into an all-new take on the most familiar conflict in wargaming that force long-time grognards to rethink their normal instincts.

Army Group South covers Von Rundstedt’s extended trek towards the Caucasus. AGS had the largest theater of operations and the highest expectations placed upon them compared to the other Army groups. While assisted by the Hungarian and Romanian armies, the best executed armored breakthroughs only went so far once the fuel trucks could not keep up with the Panzers.

WEIGHT: 6/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGN and AGC.

—description from the designer

Name: 1995: Milosevic's Last Gamble
Description:
1995 is the third iteration of our Procedural Combat Series and it examines a cold war gone hot during the Yugoslavian wars of succession. The combined might of a Serb dominated JNA and a weakened but still potent Russia move on the smaller republics in an attempt to establish A Serb dominated Yugoslavia giving Russia a foothold in NATO’s backyard.

PCS is an easy to learn, but difficult to master rules-system. Instead of Combat values, unit's are printed with a Unit Quality Rating and a Movement Allowance. Combat strength is determined randomly based on unit quality, and positioning before an attacking. The result is an original system which focuses like a laser on the unpredictability of cold war-era combat.

The OOB includes a well-researched collection of available divisions and air assets. The Russian OOB is based off the militia which attacked Grozny in 1994. The JNA is accurately represented though assumed to be at full strength. Numerous other Balkan and NATO nations are represented. 1995 focuses more on maneuver and less on chrome as there are no special counters, but lots of units instead.

WEIGHT: 7/10
SOLITAIRE: 9/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the designer

Name: 1968: TET
Description:
A few months [before June 2021,] we announced that we would be discontinuing both 1968 & 1987.

These games were designed when I first started the company and frankly, I was in a rush to put out a catalog. Unfortunately I don't think either of these games are up to the quality I want to maintain with CSL so both will no longer be available on our catalog.

If you purchased 1968 and/or 1987, I will provide you with a 20$ discount toward your next purchase.

Finally, I apologize that these games ended up being broken.

—description from the publisher

The 4th title in the Procedural Combat Series (PCS) allows players to recreate the infamous Vietnamese Tet Offensive across Vietnam. PCS is uniquely suited to simulate the conflict given the variable combat strength system being an elegant way of representing asymmetric and conventional warfare on a number of levels.

1968 is arguably the first game in the series to give a player a significant chance of winning through an Automatic Victory. The Vietnamese player is incentivized to string a series of rope-a-dope attacks together forcing the American player to constantly react or recover instead of operating offensively. The American player while having advanced weaponry, fantastic air power, and well-trained units, they lack strategic objectivity making it more difficult to turn success into political consequences/VP.

Random events can play a key role in changing the pacing of the game; like ending a turn prematurely, allowing several spent units to refresh or even exchange combat chits. The Vietnamese player receives material support through the USSR and nuances regarding supply/logistics allow the Vietnamese player a level of strategic and operational flexibility unavailable to the American units, at the exchange of raw power.

WEIGHT: 7/10
SOLITAIRE: 9/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the designer

Name: Happy Hour
Description:
Players are working in a company which is in trouble, and they fear the next round of layoffs. To increase their chances to keep their job, they start sabotaging their coworkers' health by inviting them to a nearby "boteco", a kind of pub with disgusting food and questionable cleaning. By stuffing their beloved colleagues with horrible food, they try to damage their organs. This is done by playing food cards on them. 
Players get points for the food they eat, but if they eat too much, they might die. When the first player has died, the player with most victory points wins.

—user summary
